metadata.title: Security & Privacy Personas Collection - Corrected
metadata.description: A comprehensive collection of 128+ personas from security and privacy literature
metadata.source: Systematic Literature Review: What Do Personas Say About Privacy & Security
categories: Demographic Specific Persona of Regular Users

personas.name: Black Hat Troll
personas.description: Malicious troll with harmful motivations and hacking methods targeting media and political platforms
personas.fullCitation: Matthews, John. 'Black hat trolling, white hat trolling, and hacking the attention landscape.' 2019.

personas.name: Gray Hat Troll
personas.description: Troll with mixed motivations and moderate harmful behaviors in online spaces
personas.fullCitation: Matthews, John. 'Black hat trolling, white hat trolling, and hacking the attention landscape.' 2019.

personas.name: White Hat Troll
personas.description: Troll with defensive or educational motivations, using disruption for positive purposes
personas.fullCitation: Matthews, John. 'Black hat trolling, white hat trolling, and hacking the attention landscape.' 2019.

personas.name: Security Team
personas.description: Professional security team member in organizational context responsible for threat assessment
personas.context: Understanding needs of security applications users
personas.fullCitation: Bhattarai, Suraj. 'Information security application design: understanding your users.' 2016.

personas.description: Commercial security solution provider focused on sales and implementation
personas.context: Understanding needs of security applications users
personas.fullCitation: Bhattarai, Suraj. 'Information security application design: understanding your users.' 2016.

personas.name: Ideologically Motivated Attacker (Martin)
personas.description: Attacker driven by ideological beliefs and political motivations with sophisticated techniques
personas.fullCitation: Tariq, Muhammad. 'Framing the attacker in organized cybercrime.' 2012.

personas.name: Botnet Developer (Thomas)
personas.description: Technical specialist focused on botnet creation and management for criminal purposes
personas.fullCitation: Tariq, Muhammad. 'Framing the attacker in organized cybercrime.' 2012.

personas.name: Bragger
personas.description: Attacker motivated by recognition and reputation within hacker communities
personas.fullCitation: Tariq, Muhammad. 'Framing the attacker in organized cybercrime.' 2012.

personas.name: Insider
personas.description: Internal threat actor with privileged access and organizational knowledge
personas.fullCitation: Tariq, Muhammad. 'Framing the attacker in organized cybercrime.' 2012.

personas.name: Spy
personas.description: Intelligence-gathering focused threat actor with espionage capabilities
personas.fullCitation: Tariq, Muhammad. 'Framing the attacker in organized cybercrime.' 2012.

personas.name: Financially Motivated Attacker (Kevin)
personas.description: Profit-driven cybercriminal with financial objectives and monetary focus
personas.fullCitation: Tariq, Muhammad. 'Framing the attacker in organized cybercrime.' 2012.

personas.name: Alina Action (Proactive Teacher)
personas.description: Proactive educator focused on clear learning mechanics and student engagement
personas.fullCitation: Tretow, Anna. 'Prototyping the Learning Analytics Dashboards of an Adaptive Learning Platform: Faculty Perceptions Versus Designers' Intentions.' 2023.

personas.name: Paul Privacy (Privacy-Conscious Teacher)
personas.description: Privacy-focused educator concerned with data protection and student privacy

personas.name: Naive Nadia (Unconcerned Banking User)
personas.description: Banking user with low security awareness and concern, representing 45% of users
personas.fullCitation: Wodo, Wojciech. 'Security of Digital Banking Systems in Poland: Users Study 2019.' 2020.

personas.name: Fearful Frank (Distrustful User)
personas.description: Highly distrustful banking user with security fears, representing 10% of users

personas.name: Reasonable Rick (Balanced User)
personas.description: Balanced banking user with moderate security approach, representing 45% of users

personas.name: Corrupt Software Developer
personas.description: Insider threat in software development with malicious intent and system access
personas.fullCitation: Steele, Robert. 'Adversary Centered Design: Threat Modeling Using Anti-Scenarios, Anti-Use Cases and Anti-Personas.' 2008.

personas.name: Social Activist
personas.description: Politically motivated individual targeting election systems for ideological purposes
personas.fullCitation: Steele, Robert. 'Adversary Centered Design: Threat Modeling Using Anti-Scenarios, Anti-Use Cases and Anti-Personas.' 2008.

personas.name: Professional Hacker

personas.name: Ben (Experienced Penetration Tester)

personas.fullCitation: Faily, Shamal. 'Visualising personas as goal models to find security tensions.' 2021.

personas.fullCitation: Faily, Shamal. 'Visualising personas as goal models to find security tensions.' 2021.

personas.name: Rick (Plant Operator)

personas.name: Helen Davis (Elderly Novice User)
personas.category: Demographic Specific Persona of Regular Users
personas.description: Senior user with limited technical experience and support needs for basic computing
personas.fullCitation: Bowles, John. 'The personification of reliability, safety, and security.' 2007.

personas.name: Robert McGinnis (Online Shopper)
personas.category: Demographic Specific Persona of Regular Users

personas.name: Mark (Marginally Aware)
personas.description: User with low knowledge and low motivation for security practices
personas.context: Privacy and security tool user identification
personas.fullCitation: Dupree, Jennifer. 'A case study of using grounded analysis as a requirement engineering method: Identifying personas that specify privacy and security tool users.' 2018.

personas.name: Robert (Fundamentalist)
personas.description: User with strong security beliefs and rigid practices following strict protocols
personas.context: Privacy and security tool user identification
personas.fullCitation: Dupree, Jennifer. 'A case study of using grounded analysis as a requirement engineering method: Identifying personas that specify privacy and security tool users.' 2018.

personas.name: Allison (Struggling Amateur)

personas.context: Privacy and security tool user identification
personas.fullCitation: Dupree, Jennifer. 'A case study of using grounded analysis as a requirement engineering method: Identifying personas that specify privacy and security tool users.' 2018.

personas.name: Patricia (Technician)

personas.name: Henry (Lazy Expert)
personas.description: Highly knowledgeable user with low motivation to implement security measures
personas.context: Privacy and security tool user identification
personas.fullCitation: Dupree, Jennifer. 'A case study of using grounded analysis as a requirement engineering method: Identifying personas that specify privacy and security tool users.' 2018.

personas.name: Outgoing Connector

personas.name: Reserved Trustor
